JavaScript - Scope

About scope

Variable "visibility"

Wherever a variable is defined, impact where it can be used.

Types of scope

Function scope

Variables defined within a function are not available to the public scope, unless they are put out manually.

Block scope

Using let or const to define variables within a block (for instance, in a for loop), limits the scope of that variable to that block.

Lexical scope

Consider a function nested in another functionâ€”

The parent function does nothing on its own; the main action is within the child function.

Executing only the first layer function does nothing, but it can be executed from any level within the function.

A nested function has access to the same scope as the parent.

Functions

Function expressions

Storing a function inside a variable.

Higher order functions

Functions that operate on / with other functions. They can:

  • accept other functions as arguments;
  • return a function.

Methods

A method is a function called as a property on an object.
